description: Construction of a part single, part two storey building to accommodate two (2 bed) flats; with associated amenity spaces, refuse and recycling storage and secured cycle storage
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number: Location Plan 1 to 1250; PP201C Proposed Floor Plans; P202 Proposed elevations;

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015, or any other order revoking and re-enacting that order, with or without modifications, no works shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of occupiers of adjoining properties and the appearance of the streetscene, in accordance with policies 1.1 (g) and (h) of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015) and policies Ealing Local Variation of London Plan Policy 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan. | The refuse and recycling storage as indicated on drawing number: PP201C, shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any of the dwellings hereby approved and retained permanently thereafter. This area shall not be used for any other purpose.

Reason: To provide adequate refuse and recycling storage to protect the amenities of the area and the living conditions of occupiers of the proposed residential units and the surrounding area, in accordance with policy 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policies 5.3 and 5.16 of the London Plan (2015). | Secure and sheltered cycle parking for four cycles (two per residential self-contained unit) as indicated on drawing number: PP201C, shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any of the dwellings hereby approved and retained permanently thereafter. This area shall not be used for any other purpose.

Reason: To ensure that the development provides a suitable level of cycle parking provision in the interests of sustainable transport, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2015); and National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | No part of the flat roof of the single storey and two storey elements of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area. Access to the flat roofs shall be for maintenance purposes to the sedum green roof only.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | The installation in each dwelling of an ultra-low NOx boiler with maximum NOx emissions of under 40 mg/kWh shall be completed prior to occupation and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016). | The development herby approved must be provided with filtered fresh air ventilation system capable of mitigating elevated concentrations of nitrogen oxides in the external air.  The ventilation system shall be completed prior to occupation and shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with SPG10: Noise & Vibration, policies 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016) and National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the Local Planning Authority:
a.	Bedrooms (23.00-07.00 hrs) 30 dB LAeq and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
b.	Living rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 35 dB LAeq.
c.	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the flats and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012); policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and interim SPG10: Noise and Vibration. | A detailed method statement relating to the construction of the hereby development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the use on-site. The statement shall include the following details:
a.	Removal of any earth from the site.
b.	Site clearance, demolition, excavation and construction methods.
c.	Site management and access.
d.	Signage for construction traffic, pedestrians and other users of the site.
e.	Prevention of mud and debris being deposited on Rosebank Way, York Road, Horn Lane and Western Avenue (A40).
f.	Vehicle and machinery specification.
g.	Turning manoeuvres and routeing of vehicles.
h.	Estimated number and frequency of vehicle deliveries.
i.	Parking of construction vehicles.
j.	Compliance with noise limits and vibration mitigation measures.
k.	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.
l.	Mitigation of air pollution and dust emissions during site clearance, demolition, excavation and construction works.
m.	Waste management, hazardous material storage and removal.

Reason:  In the interest of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013). | No below-ground works shall commence until the following components of a scheme to deal with the risks associated with contamination of the site, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority:

a.	In the event of contamination to land and/or water being encountered, no development shall continue until a programme of investigation and/or remedial work to include methods of monitoring and certification of such work undertaken has been submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. None of the development shall be occupied until the approved remedial works, monitoring and certification of the works have been carried out and a full validation report has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

b.	In the event that no contamination is encountered, the developer shall provide a written statement to the Local Planning Authority confirming that this was the case, and only after written approval by the Local Planning Authority shall the development be occupied.

Reason: To ensure that any ground and water contamination is identified and adequately addressed to ensure the safety of the development, the environment and to ensure the site is suitable for the proposed use.
